intro: Canthium schimperianum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and typically grows as an erect shrub with branched stems. The plant features palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Canthium schimperianum is adapted to various habitats, including woodland and savanna environments.
